definition: many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The ambiguity is the conscientious pursuit of the Tarkovsky's films.
sentences.chinese: 多義性是塔爾科夫斯基電影的自覺追求。

sentences.english: Ability to communicate across team borders is limited by the ambiguity of natural language.
sentences.chinese: 跨團隊交流的能力受到自然語言的多義性的限制。

sentences.english: If there is ambiguity, you can select from several alternatives.
sentences.chinese: 如果存在多義性，則可以從幾個選項中選擇。

sentences.english: All this results in poly-meaning of art acceptance.
sentences.chinese: 這一切都造成了藝術接受的多義性。

sentences.english: Polysemy is an important characteristic of human body words.
sentences.chinese: 多義性是人體詞的重要語義特徵。
